snippet: With all the documentation required of nurses and doctors, it’s too easy for the patients themselves to get lost.
abstract: Op-Ed article by nurse Theresa Brown warns of degree to which computer documentation has come to dominate nursing profession, to point that nurses are largely evaluated on their proficiency with system; criticizes efficiency of system and calls for rethinking way records are kept so that focus of all caregivers is patient.
lead_paragraph: With all the documentation required of nurses and doctors, it’s too easy for the patients themselves to get lost.

headline.main: When Hospital Paperwork Crowds Out Hospital Care
